snippet: The West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn once again ended violently, and people questioned why a beloved cultural celebration had become synonymous with assaults.
abstract: Annual West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn once again ends violently, with two people stabbed to death and two others shot and wounded; some residents blame young people--fueled by alcohol and excitement--for the parade getting out of hand.

byline.contributor: Randy Leonard and Vivian Yee contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn once again ended violently, and people questioned why a beloved cultural celebration had become synonymous with assaults.

headline.seo: Searching for Answers After Violence Again Mars West Indian Parade
headline.main: Searching for Answers After Violence Mars Parade
headline.print_headline: Searching for Answers After Violence Mars Parade
